title: What are the most underrated classic rock songs? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, this is almost a misnomer, as most rock songs considered “Classic” are usually very popular so underrated, hmmm.. If we look at “Classic Rock” albums there are some songs that are sometimes overlooked. Simon & Garfunkel - “Song For the Asking” from the Bridge Over Troubled Water LP ( 1970) Beautiful!  Deep Purple’s “Bloodsucker” from In Rock ( 1970), a seminal metal track with a great riff! Killer!  YES- “A Venture” - Overlooked track with a great and unique groove. sitting in between “I’ve Seen All Good People” and “Perpetual Change” on The Yes Album This is an extended version - Chris Squier’s bass has never sounded stronger.  Jethro Tull’s Aqualung LP (1971) had a few tracks played yo death, but if you had the album there are two little ditties that are really lovely little segue ways. “Wondering Aloud”  “Slipstream”  David Bowie’s Ziggy Stardust ( 1972) album’s deep tracks are great. The one that stands out for me is “Star” ,which is his take on how things may turn out for him should he become one. Interesting lyrics and very catchy!  On Rush’s 2112 ( 1976) , there are a couple of nice songs on side two, “ A Passage To Bankok”, and “The Twilight Zone”. “A Passage To Bangkok”, Live 1978  “Twilight Zone” Studio Version.  The Clash’s- London Calling LP has so many great songs ad covers so many bases, that some of the tracks seem a bit underplayed/ overlooked. I particularly the dark humor of “The Right Profile” which comments on actor Montgomery Clift’s misfortunes in a bad car accident. The horn section is particularly good, as the lyric always comes back to “He sure looks funny” and then “ It’s NOT funny” - “That’s Mongomery Clift honey!” The other track is called “Koka Kola”, another humorous take on the prevalence of cocaine and doesn’t condone nor condemn it’s use, which is the brilliance of the song. Great! Monty:  Koka Kola - Live at the US Festival., 1983. Killer!

Several by standout artists: Cowboy Song by Thin Lizzy: On an album that included the much played Boys Are Back in Town and Jailbreak.  My Babe by Foghat: Overshadowed by Slow Ride and Fool for the City.  Nobody’s Fault by Aerosmith: On the album Rocks, which is considered by some to be the finest hard rock album of all time.  And while we are on Aerosmith.. Lord of the Thighs by Aerosmith: Get Your Wings may be their most underrated album, and this may be the best song on that album.  Skateaway by Dire Straits : I could easily be convinced to include Tunnel of Love here too, but a vastly underrated Dire Straits album.  Celebration Day by Led Zeppelin: Led Zeppelin III is an undervalued album, and this song is the most underrated, although it was frequently played on tour. I especially like the way it segues from the previous track, Friends.  Brighton Rock by Queen: Sometimes dismissed as only a vehicle to showcase Brian May’s guitar playing, which it is, but it is also so much more.  I could probably come up with a few dozen more, but this is a decent start…
